title: RT69004: Rubber Laboratory - Quick Facts
text:
RT69004
Course name | RUBBER LABORATORY
Offered by | Rubber Technology Centre
Credits | 4
L-T-P | 0-0-6
Previous Year Grade Distribution
{{{grades}}}
Semester | {{{semester}}}

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Influence of nature and loading of filler on the properties of rubber, design of rubber compounds with given specifications. Study of the properties of the blends and thermoplastic elastomer from rubber and plastics. Effects of ageing, design of thermoplastic elastomer with required properties. Reverse engineering by IR, TGA and chemical; analyses and formulae reconstruction of a supplied vulcanizate; Design and testing of an oil seal with a given set of properties. Capillary rheometer study of black filled NR and SBR. Calculation of the shear stress at the wall of the two-roll mill cylinders; Determination of limiting oxygen index of a given vulcanizate and design of a flame resistant compound; Design and testing of an O-mount with specific compressive stiffness, Preparation of contact adhesive and study of the fabric to fabric and wood to wood adhesion; Study of the tack and effect of fillers on tack, adhesion between NR and aluminium; Preparation of products like rubber ball, Howai Chappal, Plastic bottle cap; Dynamic mechanical and electrical properties.
